definition: non-secret code (such as Morse code, Chinese telegraph code, ASCII etc)/plaintext (cryptography)/(of prices) clearly marked
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
weight/number/code/to pile/to stack/classifier for length or distance (yard), happenings etc

sentences.english: I'm afraid the prices are fixed in this store.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕不能講價，本店是明碼標價。

sentences.english: What's more, the price should be clearly marked.
sentences.chinese: 更重要的是，應明碼標價。

sentences.english: The input clear text is not visible on the screen.
sentences.chinese: 輸入的明碼文本在屏幕上是不可見的。

sentences.english: The price of every item on sale will be displayed.
sentences.chinese: 每一件出售商品的價格都是明碼標價。

sentences.english: Because even the smallest favors carries a price tag.
sentences.chinese: 因爲就算是最小的幫忙，都明碼標價。

sentences.english: Hamming code, a checksum error code set.
sentences.chinese: 漢明碼，一個錯誤校驗碼碼集。

sentences.english: Retailers shall clearly mark prices on the commodities provided by them.
sentences.chinese: 商店提供商品應當明碼標價。

sentences.english: Explains the basic theory and the specific construction method of the R. Hamming redundancy code.
sentences.chinese: 介紹海明碼的原理和具體的構造方法。

sentences.english: Forcing businesses to work with government to set price codes through the NRA.
sentences.chinese: 讓企業同政府合作並通過國家復興署明碼標價。

sentences.english: In most western countries store prices are fixed and people cannot bargain.
sentences.chinese: 在大部分西方國家，商店明碼實價，不能討價還價。

sentences.english: Volkswagen is not the only automaker to put a dollar amount on its brand.
sentences.chinese: 爲自身品牌明碼標價的汽車製造商並非只有大衆一家。
